channel.title: Donation Benefits
channel.description:
What is everyone's thoughts on server's donation benefits? When do you think it's too far? When do you think it becomes pay 2 win? When do you think there isn't enough? What donation benefits should be present in every server to create a better community? Share your thoughts.
/discuss

item.title: Donation Benefits
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:21, topic:546717”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=665613.msg4451032#msg4451032 date=1411348012]

it’s a donation. not a purchase.

you don’t expect to be bombarded with gifts after giving money to charities, do you?

Wow, please name me one server that has grown alot of success from providing no “donation” benefits.
[/quote]
You. Arham, missed Vain’s point.
The point was literally:

Though in my servers I usually name them purchases, like Silabsoft said.

When you donate, you are donating. The rewards, if any, are just to extra. They are not supposed to be the reason you’re giving <name of company/organization/etc> your money.
When you are purchasing something, you are paying for goods and or a service. So you expect something in return.[/quote]
ohhhhh, he was basically stating the word “donation” is not the right term.

I will shut up now.

Read full topic

When you donate, you are donating. The rewards, if any, are just to extra. They are not supposed to be the reason you’re giving <name of company/organization/etc> your money.

item.title: Donation Benefits
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:8, topic:546717”][quote author=Death Style link=topic=665613.msg4449950#msg4449950 date=1410751589]
none

servers that run off donations usually suck anyway
[/quote]

Stop living a fantasy, RSPSs are small businesses and a need a form of income to sustain themselves. Anyone who doesn’t treat it this way are:

1). Delusional
2). Ignorant

Or a little bit of column 1 and 2.[/quote][quote=“sinisoul, post:10, topic:546717”][quote author=Death Style link=topic=665613.msg4449969#msg4449969 date=1410762407]
someone who needs a form of income to run their server should consider getting an actual job
[/quote]

you are dense[/quote]

All of this.

OT: Aesthetics or convenience is fine, items, gear, xp rates, etc. is garbage.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation Benefits
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I believe donating is another one of those things where the user has to come to a decision based off of their own discretion. In my opinion, at most, I usually give people that donate a reward that doesn’t necessarily offer them free items. I would probably draw the line at a private area which includes isolated NPCs and skilling objects. In other words, I believe that not you shouldn’t necessarily give players items just because of a donation, but maybe open up a gateway for more convenient access to certain features in your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation Benefits
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:14, topic:546717”]1) donations - this term has been thrown forever in the rsps community and you all fudgeing suck. It’s not a donation if you expect something in return

  1. ingame purchases - anytime you provide something to the user that has game altering effects examples: (items with bonuses, infinite running, items only obtainable in special areas or shops, areas to train) you are giving the player a “pay to win” feeling which has been considered terrible in the online gaming communities. instead look for things that are fun yet not game altering, Cosmetic changes, Titles, emotions.[/quote]
    True, true. Never been bothered to really pay attention with terminology.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation Benefits
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

  1. donations - this term has been thrown forever in the rsps community and you all fucking suck. It’s not a donation if you expect something in return

  2. ingame purchases - anytime you provide something to the user that has game altering effects examples: (items with bonuses, infinite running, items only obtainable in special areas or shops, areas to train) you are giving the player a “pay to win” feeling which has been considered terrible in the online gaming communities. instead look for things that are fun yet not game altering, Cosmetic changes, Titles, emotions.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation Benefits
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Thanks for providing interesting points to this wanna-be discussion. The point of this thread was to start a constructive discussion on donation benefits for private servers, not just for me, but for anybody who wants to gain some, or give some. However, I forgot this was Moparscape.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation Benefits
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Purchase donate whatever

The way I would do it now would be some kind of cosmetic benefit in game/web sided benefit. E.G Spending over 100$ gets you a 10% discount on all purchases for virtual items etc, special tools developed for desktop use for easy roaming of the map or price checking or whatever (they’d require a login authenticated by the login server so giving anyone else access would be giving them access to your account). Inclusion in monthly meetings with developmental administration team to put your views over to them and have your say on how the server was run. Things in game could be that after reaching 99 in a certain skill clicking the operate button on the cape teleports you to the guild when you’re not in combat or in the wilderness. You earn the right to wear ornamental armour or something like that. Could also have some kind of access for once someone spends over 50$ they get access to a TeamSpeak for them and 4 friends (limit the rooms to 5 clients and password protect them). There’s a whole host of things if you’re not a fudgeing idiot to think of.

Shit like that that makes people feel as though they’re a part of a family inside the community is what keeps lonely 14 year olds and old virgins happy and keeps money going into your pocket.

Read full topic
